Job Title: Sr Plant Operator

Location: Plano, TX

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
Job Title & Specialty Area: Sr Plant Operator

Department: Engineering

Location: Plano, TX

Job Type: On-Site

Responsibilities

 Operate and maintain Chiller Plant equipment including but not limited to the following: chillers, chilled water pumps, condensing water pumps, cooling towers and all associate equipment (e.g. pumps, motor, gear boxes, fill material, risers, cold water basin, heat exchangers, chiller tube cleaning, make-up water system, water chemistry testing & treatment, controls, variable frequency drives, etc.) Must be able to lead and direct others (Plant Operators) in troubleshooting and resolving complex system problems. Operate and maintain Boiler Plant equipment including but not limited to the following: steam boilers, hot water boilers (domestic water heaters), deaerator tank, boiler feed tank, boiler feed pumps, water softeners, make-water system, steam traps, heat exchangers, condensate system, water chemistry testing & treatment and all associated equipment (e.g. pumps, motor, gear boxes, controls, variable frequency drives, etc.) Must be able to lead and direct others (Plant Operators) in troubleshooting and resolving complex system problems. Operate and maintain facility HVAC systems and equipment to include but not limited to the following: air handling units, fan coil units, split systems, humidifiers, exhaust fans, VAV boxes, DX units, Liebert units, and all associated equipment (e.g. fans, compressors, refrigerant, controls, pneumatic control systems, HVAC control valves, electric motors, pneumatic control systems, etc.) Must be able to perform testing and balancing of HVAC systems. Must be able to lead and direct others (Plant Operators) in troubleshooting and resolving complex system problems. Repair and maintenance of complex piping systems to include steam piping (replacing steam valves, installation of condensate pumps, steam leaks, etc.), chilled water piping and valves. Must be able to lead and direct others (Plant Operators) in troubleshooting and resolving complex system problems. Knowledge of building automation systems, fire/smoke damper repairs, OR support (temperature, pressure, humidity), and general hot/cold call support. Must be able to lead and direct others (Plant Operators) in troubleshooting and resolving complex system problems.

Work Experience

 At least 8 years related experience in multiple of the following areas: Boiler Operation and Maintenance, Chiller/Chilled Water Operation and Maintenance, HVAC Systems, or Pipe Fitting required At least 10 years related experience in multiple of the following areas: Boiler Operation and Maintenance, Chiller/Chilled Water Operation and Maintenance, HVAC Systems, or Pipe Fitting preferred

EDUCATION

 High school diploma or equivalent required Two-year Associate's degree or equivalent experience preferred

A Place Where You Belong

We put our people first. We welcome, value, and respect the beliefs, identities and experiences of our patients and colleagues. We are committed to delivering culturally effective care, creating meaningful partnerships in the communities we serve, and equipping and developing our team members to make Children’s Health a place where everyone can contribute.

Holistic Benefits – How We’ll Care For You

 Employee portion of medical plan premiums are covered after 3 years. 4%-10% employee savings plan match based on tenure Paid Parental Leave (up to 12 weeks) Caregiver Leave Adoption and surrogacy reimbursement >

Experience Level (if available): Entry level
